title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Photo Gallery
body: Photo Gallery                    Frederick Douglass, Family, and Groups   27 Photos  Photographs of Frederick Douglass, various family members, and Douglass appearing with groups.          Historic Photos - 1880s to 1890s   9 Photos  Photographs of Cedar Hill taken during the 1880s and 1890s when Frederick Douglass was alive and soon after he passed away.          Historic Photos - 1930s   9 Photos  Photographs of Cedar Hill taken during the 1930s when the Frederick Douglass Memorial and Historical Association privately operated the site as the "Frederick Douglass Memorial Home."            Historic Photos - 1960s to 1970s   14 Photos  Photographs of Cedar Hill in the 1960s and 1970s when the National Park Service acquired the site and operated it as the "Frederick Douglass Home." It was designated the Frederick Douglass National Historic Site in 1988.          Frederick Douglass   33 Photos  Frederick Douglass was the most photographed American of the nineteenth century. The National Park Service has several dozen photographs of Douglass in its collection.
